author: Andrew Beaton
title: Players Unions Join Battle Over Publicity Rights in Potential Sports-Betting Preview
text:
Sports unions and players associations said Friday that two fantasy sports games shouldn’t be allowed to use players’ images without permission, staking out a position that could have far-ranging effect following this week’s U.S. Supreme Court ruling allowing states to legalize sports betting.
The groups made their argument in an amicus brief filed in a case that is now being heard by the Indiana Supreme Court after having reached the Seventh U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals and being sent back.
